page.title: 03Boreham House
page.content: {Boreham House}was called the Institute of Agriculture until 1948.In 1954 it changed to{Ford UK.}Then it changed again and has since been a worldwide trading and training centre.Ever since {Henry Ford}bought the house and 3000 acres in 1930,it has been a kind of school.Gradually acres of land were sold to different people and now Ford have only 60 acres.When we went inside the house and walked around a bit we went up the stairs and looked at them. They were made of oak.The strange thing about the stairs was that they went round all four sides of the room and weren't supported by pillars or anything.Then we went down into the cellars.There was a boiler room with a bar in.Mr.Thomson said he had been there since 1966.Students normally come in groups of 28 for one week courses.There were 36 employees.
